channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Score: Goldman Sachs, Trump Media, CrowdStrike and More Stocks That Defined the Week
item.description: Here are some of the major companies whose stocks moved on the week’s news.

item.title: Bitcoin jumps thanks to Trump, as investors weigh Democratic ticket change
item.description: Bitcoin’s price jumped on Friday as crypto investors continued to be buoyed by Republican presidential front-runner Donald Trump’s embrace of digital ...

item.title: Stocks Drop During Tech Outage at End of Volatile Week
item.description: The Dow industrials and Nasdaq fell after a global technology outage knocked out operations for a range of companies and forced airlines to ground fli...

item.title: ‘I’m not jealous — just genuinely curious’: How can a woman work from home and mind her 3-year-old child at the same time?
item.description: “What do you all think about employees who work from home and have little kids to watch at the same time?”

item.title: Activist Elliott Takes Big Stake in Starbucks
item.description: Elliott Investment Management has been discussing privately ways to boost the coffee giant’s share price.

item.title: ‘She screamed and raged at me’: I have power of attorney for my mother’s $3 million estate — but my sister feels sidelined. How do I get her off my back?
item.description: “I want to act ethically and responsibly on behalf of our mother.”

item.title: Amex Has a Gold Opportunity
item.description: American Express shares have evaded most worries about the American spender, but hit a bit of a speed bump after the company’s latest earnings report.

item.title: ‘She’s a danger to herself’: Our late brother left us $3 million, but my sister is in hospital with schizophrenia. Should I take control of her finances?
item.description: “At the moment, we are both in Florida, but the inheritance is in a California probate court.”

item.title: Rivals Emerge to Ozempic and Zepbound---but With a Lag
item.description: Big pharma challengers like Roche and Amgen could grab a slice of the obesity market.

item.title: ‘I’ve been locked in a battle to recoup my money’: My debit card was cloned and charged $2,300, but my bank insists my actual card was used. What can I do?
item.description: “At the time, I only had one family member in the state, and they did not have access to the card.”
